intro: Inulopsis camporum, commonly known as the Campora inula, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and is known for its yellow-orange ray flowers. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and leaves. Inulopsis camporum is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive floral display.
